page.title: 06ENERGY.
page.content:
{ENERGY CONSUMPTION IN OWSTON { ____________________________} There are a variety of domestic fuels used in Owston and the surrounding area but the chief, and most important source of energy is electricity. All houses are lighted by it and several use it for cooking,warmth and water heating. It is extensively used on the farms and, because of its importance, two farms own generators which are used in the event of mains failure and which are lent out in emergency.
Other domestic fuels are wood, solid fuel, calor gas and oil. One house has straw-burning equipment for heating and another has solar panels. vehicles are run on petrol or diesel; all fuels , whether domestic or for transport, have to be obtained from outside the village.Coal and oil are delivered.
